Probably "data-access events" can be seen as "security-related"  because they are actually authorization granted/denied events, but I believe "access to data" is worth mentioning somehow.
Suggestion 2:
I also noticed this preamble is copied over from https://elasticsearch_61235.docs-preview.app.elstc.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/enable-audit-logging.html , so maybe it's simply enough to link to that here.
Suggestion 3:
Maybe stress (here, or on the" enabled audit logging" page from point 2 above) that audit must be configured on every node (i.e. the static settings docs say Static settings must be set on every relevant node in the cluster, and I suggest we explicitly mention that for audit all nodes are "relevant").
